metadata.synopsis: Gale's default dialog that triggers whenever you speak to Gale in the game world. Covers a variety of topics that mostly react to Gale-related events that took place.

10.speaker: Gale
10.text: I've had my suspicions about you for some time now. And there you go, confirming them with truly audacious gusto.
10.context: InternalNodeContext: Character saw Astarion use his 'bite' ability on someone else (probably in combat, but not necessarily) and confronts him about being a vampire.

19.speaker: Gale
19.text: Aha! I knew  it. I knew you'd try something like that eventually. Though I wish you'd done it with a bit less enthusiasm.
19.context: InternalNodeContext: Character was bitten by Astarion in gameplay.NodeContext: At first triumphant - Gale'sbeen proved right about something (which he loves to be, of course). Then feeling the smart of Astarion's attempted bite.

20.speaker: Gale
20.text: Still, I can hardly blame a vampire for being true to its nature. You are a vampire, are you not?

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I am. But I'm a friendly one - I promise.

50.speaker: Gale
50.text: There was nothing friendly about what you just did to me. But I'll humour you - we'll call that a momentary lapse in good sense, shall we?

32.speaker: Gale
32.text: I thought I'd awaken feeling, well, drained. But I seem to be quite as well as ever.
32.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion tried to bite this companion during the night, but you woke up and discovered he was a vampire. You talked it through and resolved things peacefully in CAMP_AstarionHunger_IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice.lsj

73.speaker: Gale
73.text: Admittedly, that's not saying much given our ongoing predicament. Nonetheless, I'm glad I woke up when I did.
73.context: NodeContext: Sincere, but not giving too much away (referring to the orb, which he may or may not have told the player about)

28.speaker: Gale
28.text: As I said, I'm willing to move past the whole exsanguination issue, so long as you can promise to keep that hunger of yours in check.
28.context: NodeContext: Sincere, but not giving too much away (referring to the orb, which he may or may not have told the player about)

21.speaker: Player
21.context: NodeContext: Sincere, but not giving too much away (referring to the orb, which he may or may not have told the player about)

14.speaker: Gale
14.text: I know what it is to have an uncontrollable hunger within you. You can hardly be blamed for your desperation in trying to satisfy it.
14.context: NodeContext: Sincere, but not giving too much away (referring to the orb, which he may or may not have told the player about)

44.speaker: Gale
44.text: A vampire among us? So be it.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

90.speaker: Lae'zel
90.text: A vampire among us? So be it.
90.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

45.speaker: Lae'zel
45.text: But should I wake with so much as a drop of blood on my neck, I will end him.

12.speaker: Lae'zel
12.text: For his sake, he best not develop an appetite for githyanki.

23.speaker: Shadowheart
23.text: I'd just better not wake in the night to find fangs at my throat.

55.speaker: Wyll
55.text: Fine - as long as he keeps his fangs off our necks.

39.speaker: Karlach
39.text: Yeah. And I'm way too hot to touch.

61.speaker: Shadowheart
61.text: A vampire? Well that explains the pallor.
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: Given our group's nature, I don't see much harm. We're each monsters in the making, after all.

74.speaker: Wyll
74.text: Hunting with vampires? Never thought I'd see the day.
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

26.speaker: Wyll
26.text: Very well - but I'm keeping an eye on you. And no wisecracks about having us for supper.
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to Astarion directlyNodeContext: Said to Astarion directly

71.speaker: Karlach
71.text: Vamps don't scare me. As long as they keep their teeth to themselves.
71.context: NodeContext: Wrapping up the topic, determination wabout what comes next

80.speaker: Karlach
80.text: No sense judging someone for who they are. Except devils, obviously.

7.speaker: Gale
7.text: So, we move forwards. And when the occasion arises, we show our enemies exactly how sharp those teeth of yours can be.
7.context: NodeContext: Wrapping up the topic, determination wabout what comes next

31.speaker: Gale
31.text: So, we move forwards. And when the occasion arises, we show our enemies exactly how sharp those teeth of yours can be.
31.context: NodeContext: Wrapping up the topic, determination wabout what comes next

48.speaker: Gale
48.text: So, we move forwards. And when the occasion arises, we show our enemies exactly how sharp those teeth of yours can be.
48.context: NodeContext: Wrapping up the topic, determination wabout what comes next

5.speaker: Karlach
5.text: A vamp, huh? Interesting. Keep your teeth to yourself, Astarion, and we won't have any issues.

9.speaker: Karlach
9.text: Anyway, you'd burn your tongue off if you went for this neck.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I promise you - I'll sate myself on our foes alone from now on.
1.context: NodeContext: With a smile - poking fun at Astarion's flair for the flamboyant

34.speaker: Gale
34.text: A choice both efficient and pragmatic. Most unlike you.
34.context: NodeContext: With a smile - poking fun at Astarion's flair for the flamboyant

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I'll resist with all my strength.
52.context: NodeContext: unsure - player didn't exactly promise not to feed on him again

30.speaker: Gale
30.text: Well then - let's hope you've strength to spare.
30.context: NodeContext: unsure - player didn't exactly promise not to feed on him again

63.speaker: Gale
63.text: And how are you this morning, my blood-thirsty friend?
63.context: InternalNodeContext: Avatar Astarion tried to bite A DIFFERENT companion during the night, but they woke up and discovered he was a vampire. They talked it through and resolved things peacefully in CAMP_AstarionHunger_IVB_SCO_Avatar_Choice.lsjNodeContext: Eyebrow raised - still not entirely convinced Astarion is to be trusted

82.speaker: Gale
82.text: If you'd had your way our number would be one fewer by now. We're fortunate you were caught red-fanged.

38.speaker: Gale
38.text: Still, there was no real harm done. So long as you can keep that craving of yours in check, I'm happy that our paths remain aligned.

94.speaker: Gale
94.text: I think it's about time you and I had a little chat. An honest one.
94.context: InternalNodeContext: Companion confronts Avatar Astarion, telling him they know he's a vampire. Triggers if you make it to Act 2 without him telling you himself or revealing it via camp night bite scene/using bite attack in front of you.

56.speaker: Gale
56.text: At first I wasn't sure. Some of your behaviour doesn't exactly match what my traveller's tomes describe of one of your... disposition.
56.context: NodeContext: Like admonisihing a puppy, knows Astarion will just do what he wants

53.speaker: Gale
53.text: The ability to walk in broad daylight, for example, with not a burn in sight. I suppose we have your parasite to thank for that.
53.context: NodeContext: Like admonisihing a puppy, knows Astarion will just do what he wants

57.speaker: Gale
57.text: But as for the rest - well, there can be only one conclusion. You're a vampire.
57.context: NodeContext: Like admonisihing a puppy, knows Astarion will just do what he wants

88.speaker: Player
88.context: NodeContext: Like admonisihing a puppy, knows Astarion will just do what he wants

40.speaker: Gale
40.text: Do not undersell yourself, you may not have the grand lair nor loyal swarm but a vampire spawn is still part of the vampire family. Technically.
40.context: NodeContext: Like admonisihing a puppy, knows Astarion will just do what he wants

77.speaker: Gale
77.text: The real conundrum here is why weren't you honest with me?
77.context: NodeContext: Like admonisihing a puppy, knows Astarion will just do what he wants

33.speaker: Gale
33.text: I'm quite open-minded. It's one of my finer qualities, and there's some stiff competition in that department.
33.context: NodeContext: Like admonisihing a puppy, knows Astarion will just do what he wants

69.speaker: Player
69.text: There's open-minded, and then there's 'happy to sleep next to a vampire spawn.' I didn't think you'd like it much.
69.context: NodeContext: Like admonisihing a puppy, knows Astarion will just do what he wants

47.speaker: Gale
47.text: Nothing wrong with a bit of caution, I suppose. Better to sound out friends and enemies alike before revealing that kind of secret.
47.context: NodeContext: Like admonisihing a puppy, knows Astarion will just do what he wants

15.speaker: Gale
15.text: Nothing wrong with a bit of caution, I suppose. Better to sound out friends and enemies alike before revealing that kind of secret.
15.context: NodeContext: Like admonisihing a puppy, knows Astarion will just do what he wants

65.speaker: Gale
65.text: With that said, I'm more than happy to continue onwards. But no more hiding things from me. Agreed?
65.context: NodeContext: Like admonisihing a puppy, knows Astarion will just do what he wants

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I can promise you fewer secrets?
0.context: NodeContext: Like admonisihing a puppy, knows Astarion will just do what he wants

29.speaker: Gale
29.text: *Sigh.* I suppose that will do for now. But none that pose the threat of imminent death or destruction, for me, or yourself, or anyone else for that matter.
29.context: NodeContext: Like admonisihing a puppy, knows Astarion will just do what he wants

79.speaker: Player
79.text: No more secrets, on my honour.
79.context: NodeContext: Wry, knows Astarion's a bit of a trickster

11.speaker: Gale
11.text: You almost said that without smiling.
11.context: NodeContext: Wry, knows Astarion's a bit of a trickster

70.speaker: Gale
70.text: Now, unless you've any other deep, dark secrets to own up to, shall we continue on?

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Say nothing. Stare into Gale's eyes, unblinking.
4.context: NodeContext: Not overly bothered, didn't think this would work

37.speaker: Gale
37.text: I'll take that as a no, shall I? *Sigh*. It was worth a try.
37.context: NodeContext: Not overly bothered, didn't think this would work

72.text: I can tell you what I don't like. Unwittingly sleeping next to someone with a taste for blood and a tendency to lie about it.
72.context: NodeContext: Annoyed, but willing to move past it

86.speaker: Gale
86.text: I can tell you what I don't like. Unwittingly sleeping next to someone with a taste for blood and a tendency to lie about it.
86.context: NodeContext: Annoyed, but willing to move past it

66.speaker: Gale
66.text: I'm happy to draw a line under the matter and move forward. But from here on, no more hiding things from me. Agreed?
66.context: NodeContext: Stern, not very impressed about it but willing to move on

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I had no choice. My old master put a curse on me. Forbade me ever revealing my true nature.
75.context: NodeContext: Pleased with himself for figuring this out

91.speaker: Gale
91.text: How tragic. Well, lucky for you your master couldn't predict the observational cunning of our troupe's resident Waterdhavian wizard. Your silence spoke volumes.
91.context: NodeContext: Pleased with himself for figuring this out

87.speaker: Gale
87.text: How tragic. Well, lucky for you your master couldn't predict the observational cunning of our troupe's resident Waterdhavian wizard. Your silence spoke volumes.
87.context: NodeContext: Pleased with himself for figuring this out

58.text: I'm sure you could have found your way around that with a bit of imagination.

18.speaker: Gale
18.text: I'm sure you could have found your way around that with a bit of imagination.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Most people don't react as well as you.

54.speaker: Gale
54.text: I can see the truth in that. But you and I aren't 'most people'.

68.speaker: Gale
68.text: I don't care if you eat blood or boiled eggs for breakfast, but if we're to survive this parasitic adventure of ours, we have to trust each other.

8.speaker: Player
8.context: NodeContext: Enjoying how smart he feels

84.speaker: Gale
84.text: Oh, it was quite easy, really. I took note of certain abilities you possessed, certain aspects of your behaviour depending on our environment. And those teeth of yours. Quite the pair of canines.
84.context: NodeContext: Enjoying how smart he feels

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Couldn't be further off the mark.
27.context: NodeContext: Good natured but not letting the player get away with it

3.speaker: Gale
3.text: No need to deny it. The bat's out of the bag, so to speak.
3.context: NodeContext: Good natured but not letting the player get away with it

67.speaker: Gale
67.text: But why weren't you honest with me?
67.context: NodeContext: Not impressed, knows you've lied to him

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I'm telling you, I'm not a vampire.
64.context: NodeContext: Not impressed, knows you've lied to him

24.speaker: Gale
24.text: I see. You're a dishonest vampire, and that's far worse.
24.context: NodeContext: Not impressed, knows you've lied to him

16.speaker: Gale
16.text: As you're not willing to engage in a frank conversation on the matter, I think we'll leave it there.
16.context: NodeContext: Not impressed, knows you've lied to him
